Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as the other reviews don't be too scared!!”
Reviews.Author: LollieP123
Reviews.Content: Well first before booking it we came to trip advisor to read the reviews. As you can see they are very mixed! biu as the rooms were cheap and we were planning to be out and about for the few days we decided to book it. We arrived and were suprised at first as there was a lovely lounge which we did not expect. We were prepared for the worst as we walked into to the room but it wasn't too bad it wasn't spick and span but there was nothing really dirty. The bathroom was nice and clean. As for the breakfast... well it wasn't great but that was ok as we just ate some place else. If you are looking for somewhere cheap to stay for a few days and are not fussed about luxury stay here. The station is near and so is Hyde Park its easy to get most places from here and doesn't take to long, but Advice: get your food out! :)

Reviews.Title: “Dirty and uncomfortable”
Reviews.Author: Will-Sean
Reviews.Content: Stayed here at the end of November 2011, and although was cheap, I would rather have stayed in a hostel dorm! The man on reception was rude, standing there eating chewing gum and coughing all over the counter. The stairs leading to the bedroom are crumbling away, and I nearly fell down them. The room was dirty, window would not shut so had to sleep with that open all night, bathroom was mouldy. Did not even attempt to try the breakfast as did not want to catch food poisoning. Never again will I stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel it is terrible”
Reviews.Author: travel4fun111
Reviews.Content: It is disgusting and rude staff make it a avoid at all costs! When someone tried to follow us into our room. The front desk laughed as they watched us on the security tapes. Do not stay here.

Reviews.Title: “DON'T STAY HERE!!!”
Reviews.Author: HighUpAbove
Reviews.Content: Me and my best friend looked for a cheap place to stay and agreed to prepare for the worst, we didn't plan to be in the room that much anyway. We never believed it could be that horrible that some here had written. But when we got there it was even worse than our worse expactiations. First when we came they said that we had cancelled our booking, we had already paid! The receptionist was so rude and did not let us look at the papers because "we wouldn't understand". I argued with him and he told us to come back in two hours. We finally got a room BUT it rained through the ceiling in the bathroom, suddenly a loud bang and a flash came and everything went dark. We know to never mix electricity and water! But we were forced to sleep in the room for the night anyway. The day after we demanded to have a new room and after some discussions we finally got it. But throughout the week, the same really rude receptionist worked every time we came back to the hotel, didn't matter if it was during lunch time, morning or late night. Don't tell yourself "Expect the worse so you won't be disappointed." Because this was worse than our nightmares! DON'T STAY HERE!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: sara k
Reviews.Content: Its a nice comfortable hotel in an excellent area. The room was spotless, cleaned everyday. We had a double room and it was a good enough size considering its a London hotel where rooms tend to be small. The bathroom had a great shower, quite big and perfect water pressure. I'd definately pick this hotel to stay in again.

Reviews.Title: “Was not great”
Reviews.Author: Robert C
Reviews.Content: It is a very old complex. Alot of the things in our room were falling apart. It kind of had a musty smell too. Aside from that the service was ok, the location was good and the value for money was also good. I would recommend to the budget traveller. but if you want luxury this is certainly not the place.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: nicolekidd94
Reviews.Content: We have just returned home after staying in this hotel for a long weekend, and after reading all of the negative reviews we were slightly wary on what to expect! However on arrival we were pleasantly surprised, staff were friendly and helpful and our room was both spacious and clean with fresh towels daily! The location was excellent, with everything you need just around the corner, and the tube station was just a 2 minute walk! If you live in a palace then you may find fault with this hotel, but for the price you are paying, it is excellent value for money! Would definitetly stay here again in the future, and are already planning our stay for next year!

Reviews.Title: “â€œClean and friendly. Would stay again.â€�”
Reviews.Author: Claire B
Reviews.Content: I had a very pleasent stay, nice place and very friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Not very good.”
Reviews.Author: Shazski186460
Reviews.Content: Myself and my mother stayed here last weekend for 2 nights, the outside is impressive and the reception area is nice. The room are a massive disappointment, the walls and paintwork are dirty, the tray with the kettle had a good layer of old dust on. 1 double bed and four singles, the beds apart from 2 were very uncomfortable and need replacing, the bases of the beds were dirty and I found hairs pillowcase, There was years worth of dirt and grime on the net curtains Breakfast was a flask of coffee, no tea and none offered, cornflakes, bread rolls or croissants. The breakfast staff did not even speak to you. Man on reception was lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Not that bad really”
Reviews.Author: takFrankfurt
Reviews.Content: I went there with a group of students, and we were very apprehensive indeed, what with all the horrible reviews on the internet. It really was not bad at all. Rooms were small, breakfast was basic, there were problems with water pressure and a few more minor issues: nothing unexpected for this kind of place. The rooms were clean enough, there were fresh towels every day, and we appreciated little luxuries such as TV (poor reception, to be honest) and electric kettles plus tea etc. in the rooms. We did not encounter any serious hygiene problems. Location is excellent. Service was friendly throughout. Do not book there if you are looking for peace and quiet, though: Student groups in six-bed-rooms will not always be utterly noiseless all night.

Reviews.Title: “would rather sleep on the street”
Reviews.Author: anneL86
Reviews.Content: not as much the state of the hotel as the service of the people working there. Not that it was the lap of luxury,the shower was cold and not so much as a bar of soap there. The receptionist was one of the rudest people working in the service industry ive ever met. I cant believe he was hired and i cant believe he is still working there. I left a dress there and the ignorance i was met with when i rang about it-I certainly wont be getting it back. Horrible, rude people.

Reviews.Title: “We hated it :miserable and cheap”
Reviews.Author: Cristian786
Reviews.Content: We stood there for 3 days and we had for breakfast only butter bread milk and cheap cereals and some stale croissant with coffee. The room we had spent our first night in was miserable and only after we spoke with the manager they gave us some "proper" room. But guess what? No television also. Touche.!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: Ruth c
Reviews.Content: I have travelled a little in my time and this was an experience second to none. This hotel is all about service and I mean excellent service, you really feel like a guest in this warm and friendly establishment, The great staff will help you with anything you ask. The hotel itself is "tres chic" indeed and adds to the whole intamate encounter, I highly recommend it

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value for money”
Reviews.Author: katie b
Reviews.Content: Very helpful staff, very friendly, looked after us in any way they could, lovely rooms, great prices!!

Reviews.Title: “Dark, depressing, smelly”
Reviews.Author: allegro_barbaro
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. If you saw this room as part of a prison documentary you would demand action on humanitarian grounds. It was shockingly bad........chipboard furniture with the laminate coming off, stale smelling and dingy. It seems that the original high ceilings have been been lowered and this gives a claustrophobic feel to the place not to mention that it cuts out most of the natural light from the sash window (picture added for you to gasp at!). It is so sad that such beautiful buildings have been reduced to this. The 'breakfast' was equally bad. Rock hard stale pastries, baaaaaad coffee and not a server to be seen. We ran out of the place but not before grudgingly handing over Â£200. STAY AWAY FOR YOUR OWN GOOD.

Reviews.Title: “O.K if you're not used to the RITZ and not too fussy”
Reviews.Author: lizzywiiz
Reviews.Content: Travelled here with my 2 friends, yes the room wasn't amazing, quite small, poor water pressure, slanty ceilings BUT we just wanted a cheap room for 3 nights so we could spend more money on clothes etc. Good location about a 5 minute walk from Queensway tube station which is on the central line about 3 stops from Oxford circus. Staff tend to get a bit over tidy when cleaning rooms e.g. putting carrier bags in the bin so if you're saving them make sure they're in your suitcase! Breakfast isn't the best but they do a lot more if you ask but it basically delivers what you'd expect for the price. To avoid being sung by excess charges on checkout book online like we did, we had no trouble

Reviews.Title: “Dead before we would go back”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaMeb
Reviews.Content: Terrible bed. I could feel each spring. Not clean. Charged you to use the safe but didn't tell you until you checked out. Good location

Reviews.Title: “Horrible place, please stay away!”
Reviews.Author: Daria_Be
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately I had the occasion to work at this hotel for a few months in 2004. I can easily say it was the worst place I have ever been. The owner is the old guy from Afghanistan (I know many people from Afghanistan and I have nothing against them - they are usually kind and honest people) and he is a greedy, unkind, con man. He always books more rooms than he has available (in case someone won't come) and then when everyone is coming and there is no more rooms for arrivals, he just says something about electricity or leak problem in your room, and he will send you to another hotel (sometimes the hotel he will send you to is 20 minutes walk from Apollo Hotel, but the owner of Apollo Hotel won't provide you any cab). And believe me - it's not true when they tell you their card reader doesn't work - it works but everything that goes through card reader the owner has to put as his income and when you pay by cash it's never registered anywhere (try it and ask for the receipt when you pay by cash - they will just give some piece of paper with the handwritten price on it). For continental breakfast he buys the cheapest milk, juices (and mixes it with water of course), cornflakes, croissants, etc. And be careful with telephone calls from your room - if they can they will charge you hell lot more than they should. I won't say anything about disgusting rooms because I think everything was said already. There are about 5 or 6 other hotels at the same street and believe - each one is hundred times better.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty & overpriced with sleezy staff to match”
Reviews.Author: osborne1987
Reviews.Content: I had booked with another hotel but unfortunately, they cancelled on me last minute. I found this hotel and was told that the cost would be Â£100. The other room that I had booked with the hotel across the road was only Â£65 so I was aware that what he was charging me was a rip off. However, I had an exam in London and needed to find a hotel quickly so I didn't really have enough time to shop around. Their card reader wasn't working so I went and withdrew the money form the nearby cash machine and came back. The sleezy guy at the desk then said it would now cost me Â£120 because he'd just had a word with his manager. I wasn't happy but like I say, needed somewhere to stay. I handed over the money and was given a key. The guy on the desk was sleezy, unprofessionial and spoke English pretty poorly considering I suspect he probably had been living in England long enough. The hotel was really badly decorated and my room was on the fourth floor. As soon as I walked through the door, I just wanted to cry. The locks didn't work, bed linen was absolutely disguting, really dirty windows and the whole suite absolutely reeked of cigarette smoke. Whilst I was up there, the telephone in the room rang and the guy at the desk now said that I needed to pay Â£150 because his manager changed his mind. He said he would come and give me an invoice. By this point, I'd decided that it was just getting ridiculous and there was no way I was going to pay Â£150 for one of the most disgusting rooms I've ever seen. I rang my mum to tell her what she was happening and she told me to leave. Whilst I was on the phone, the guy knocked on my door and gave me the invoice. I told him that I was just on the phone to my mum and didn't have the money on me so would have to go to the cash machine anyway. I told him that I'd go and get the money as soons as I'd finished speaking with my mum. He nodded his head and accepted this. However, after about 5 minutes, I got this weird feeling that he was still there so I opened the door and he'd been waiting outside my bedroom. I told him once again that there was no point in waiting because I'd have to go out and leave the hotel to get the money anyway so he might as well wait in reception. Once again, I carried on talking and found him outside my bedroom. As a young woman by herself, I didn't exactly relish the prospect of being on the fourth floor of a 70's style badly decorated sleezy hotel anyway but having a sleezy man wait outside my bedroom was just icing on the cake. I firmly told him to leave again and this time he listened. When I went downstairs and demanded my money back, he then said that I only had to pay Â£120 which pretty much confirmed that he was ripping me off. Whilst waiting for him to give my Â£120 back, I saw the way he dealt with an oldish Dutch couple and was disgusted at how rude, unprofessional and generally unhelpful he was with them. He was not patient with the obvious language barriers and was very unhelpful at explaining the underground system. I strongly recommend that people do not choose this hotel, particularly if they are female and by themselves. The only good thing to say about this hotel is that it is well located.

Reviews.Title: “Experienced Traveler”
Reviews.Author: Nomad2916
Reviews.Content: What a piece of crap. No heat, no hot water and half the electrical outlets were functioning. No tv remote, but the reception was so bad, it didn't matter. Front desk was lacking in manors and education. I complained about the forementioned problems and got "We are working on them." I suppose that meant the guy paining in the lobby. Only stayed two nights. Never got any better or nor any follow up. Do not stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I ever stayed,carpet was so old,the bathroom stunk,we had to buy air freshners! The room was so small and depressing”
Reviews.Author: unknownLisa
Reviews.Content: Cried my first night there,such an awful room,felt like I was in a crack house! I have back packed through Asia and this was on par with the worst rooms we stayed in. The only save and grace was the location!

Reviews.Title: “One of the worst hotels in the country!”
Reviews.Author: Sammie1015
Reviews.Content: I wouldn't say you even get your moneys worth! People running around on all floors screaming, banging on doors all night long. Dirty, drawers broken, hardly any water coming out of shower. Cold! No satellite or freeview, not that it mattered as the aerial in the back of the tv has wires exposed and so poor reception. No remote! Breakfast was poor and almost non-existent. As a young women on my own I did not feel safe here and couldn't wait to check out.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: maryBathgate Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: very basic 3/4 beds per room had to put luggage on spare bed as there was no room on floor for cases. no lift we were on 4/5 floor not good when we had to carry our cases, asked for help and was ignored.

Reviews.Title: “The most awful hotel I've never been”
Reviews.Author: Otomok
Reviews.Content: - The room was very dirty (ground oily in the bathroom) - You need to make the water flow during 10 minutes to get hot water. - The water flows so slowly that it takes really too much time to feel wet - The room was on the 5th floor without elevator - No shampoo, no soap - Sink difficultly accessible behind the shower - Noisy The only 2 good things are the location and the heater (A big one, so you can't be cold). But for that price, I think you can find a lot better somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Party central”
Reviews.Author: SteveB15
Reviews.Content: If you want a place to stay where you can party until the wee hours of the morning this is the place for you. If, however, you're like me and look forward to getting a good nights sleep after a long day of sightseeing then avoid this hotel. I can put up with a lot if I can stay at a budget hotel in a good location. Especially when Traveling on my own. What I don't like is being kept awake until 3:00 in the morning with loud music and people yelling, all in the main lobby. And this happened on two consecutive nights. Reviewers elsewhere have already mentioned the general disrepair of the rooms and griminess. There are two staffers who I did find to be helpful but there is indeed one employee who is very rude. The only other thing worth mentioning is that for anybody with diminished mobility climbing in and out of the bathtubs could be hazardous. They have high sides with nothing in the tub to increase footing. If you want a budget hotel in this location the Troy Hotel right next door might be a better alternative.

Reviews.Title: “Look elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: JudithandKeith
Reviews.Content: Not a pleasant experience - definately the lowest standard hotel that I/we have stayed in. I have traveled world wide & stayed in many countries. We did not have the breakfast as we were concerned about the entire hygiene, health & safety standards. We were told the lift was 'servicable' but not working!! 86 steps to the room with very poorly decorated, need of renovation, badly fitted wood laminate floors, bathroom close to unuseable, dodgy electrical fittings (i.e. socket cellotaped in place). Summing up - health & safety would have a field day.

Reviews.Title: “below expectations (low expectations)”
Reviews.Author: calfeater
Reviews.Content: im not complaining, just stating what i experienced so others can make decisions. our room was on the 1st floor and hotel staff and friends treat the lobby as a "hang out place" which can get quite loud. no pens/paper in the room. one bed was covering the entrance to the bathroom, and they seem to lock the hotel at night. one of my biggest concerns is THE AREA. cheap area located in Westminster NOT london. sketchy area.. Our trip would have been way better in a different area. But you get what you pay for. There is a hostel down the street offering double private rooms for 35 pounds! (low season) Only one key for the room is available, so if you and your partner want to split up even for a small amount of time it is not possible unless you both have phones or one person remains at the hotel. Also the mattress was springy.. Internet is 5 pounds a night!

Reviews.Title: “Please avoid this place.”
Reviews.Author: Nicolaj2010
Reviews.Content: I came to this hotel on Monday 13th September. After 3 days of the family in the adjoining room and someone on the floor above keeping me awake (no sound proofing) I complained to the receptionist at 5:15 on the friday morning. He informed me that the individual in the room above me "was a little ill" and tapped his forehead before offering me a new room. This was after he had disentangled himself from the sleeping blanket wrapped round him. I returned on the following day to a new room which I can only describe as a hazzard to human health (I have photographic proof of all of the following room condition). There are cables accross the linoleum floor (no carpet), there is mould growing on the bathroom ceiling, the walls are broken and the wall sockets are loose (the one with the kettle plug in has a broken plug and crackles when switched on). The toilet handle is broken (one could easily cut themselves open on it) and chunks of plaster are missing from the walls. Oh and I forgot the 3 foot stain on the bedroom ceiling. Then on the Friday I asked the lady whom I presume to be the manageress about the bag of washing which had gone missing from my first room the day I left, bearing in mind that only myself and the cleaner had keys to get in there and I was concerned as most of my underwear was in it. The cleaner denied it and as (according to the manager) it was my word against hers there was nothing the Apollo could do. Then on the Saturday my elderly pensioner mother took time out from nursing my seriously ill stepfather to enquire about a refund for the rest of my stay, which out of the goodness of her heart she had paid for as a kind gift. She was told that there was a 7 day cancellation policy (which is different to the 24 hour one the receptionist told me of on arrival) and as I was booked for another 7 days she would not receive her money. Quite honestly were it possible to give this property minus stars I would do so. I know it is in a great location but what use is that if the accommodation leaves you in no fit state to enjoy it. Also the staff are rude, abusive and apart from the reception area I have not seen satellite TV (as advertised) anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Good location - shame about the hotel”
Reviews.Author: existenzialist
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately we didn't book a second night at the less expensive Travelodge in Southwark so had to spend it here on our second night. I stumbled upon this description of the hotel: "Apollo hotel is a beautiful and pristine 2 star hotel in one of the best locations in London. It is ideal for central London and Hyde park. Every sightseeing place is a short distance from Apollo Hotel. Bayswater & Queensway are short walk from the hotel as is Hyde Park." The location is excellent as the above implies but the first seven words I'd have to disagree with.... The majority of the reviews you will have read are correct. The main benefit of staying here is the location and maybe if you got it at a dirt cheap rate. Whilst the towels and white linen were clean the top bedsheet was particularly manky, enough to make us not use it. The bathroom looked clean enough and was glad to see that the floors were laminate and not carpet as, judging by the carpet in the hallway, I wouldn't want to be walking barefoot! The mattresses were incredibly run down and springy and the general appearance of the walls and furniture was shabby. I think another review wrote that if they gave the place a lick of paint, changed the dirty curtains, got new beds and improved the breakfast (dubious quality in a dubious basement room where no-one smiles!), it would be more than adequate. I guess the fact it's full regularly means the owners don't see the point which is a pity as it could be a place worth staying. It reminded me of run down hostel/student accomodation, both of which I've had better accommodation from.

Reviews.Title: “Normal hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sohvik
Reviews.Content: This hotell is in very good location, if you need just place where overnight, then this is right hotel to stay. Staff was friendly, breakfast (continental) was normal, sheets were clean. As we left hotel early in the morning and returned only for sleep, this hotel was good choice. As London is very beautiful and there are so many interesting places to visit, do not ever waste time to rest in hotel. You may rest at beach or at home, just enjoy this nice city!

Reviews.Title: “Stay away”
Reviews.Author: marygal49
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in cheaper hotels in London but NEVER of this quality. It has 3 stars on the door of the hotel, this should say -3. Rom tiny, bathroom cramped and dirty. Room extremely smelly, it was like in the days of smoking rooms. Smell of dampness and smoking stopped me sleeping. Continental breakfast consisted of toast/tea/coffee, croissants and cornflakes. Oh and a juice. Disappointing to say the least. The hotel is in a great location, shame the quality of the rooms etc let it down.

Reviews.Title: “2 star = 2 star”
Reviews.Author: rua19
Reviews.Content: Having flicked through the reviews before booking the Apollo hotel, I knew I was taking a gamble booking it - however it was hardly the horrific scene I was expecting. I booked a room for 3, having done this in the past I got a small room with 2 single beds and a pull out bed on the floor, however we were delighted to see a double bed and a single bed in the room which we were well able to move around in. To be brief, The main pro's as we found them; 1)Location Location Location !! 2)Cleanliness- I'm fussy when it comes to this and I was completely satisfied with the room and bathroom - our towels were changed everyday. 3)Staff at the desk seemed nice The main cons as we found them; 1) Beds weren't in great shape- bit lumpy 2) Our window was jammed and we could hear the busy traffic of Bayswater Road late at night All we wanted was a safe place to sleep with good location as we were gone all day & part of the night - Apollo hotel was adequate for this, its not the lap of luxury but as I said 2 star = 2 star.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but nothing else”
Reviews.Author: sding02
Reviews.Content: This is a 3-star hotel but it certainly didn't feel that way. Staff manning the office were not friendly, and have a "couldn't care" attitude, not very helpful when asked questions on how to get around the city. There is no lift in this hotel, so we have to lug our 15kg luggage up ourselves. The beds are lumpy and sunken in the middle and heater in our room didn't work. When we asked the staff about the heater, they gave us the "live with it" kind of answer. Location is good, no doubt, close to shops, restaurants, and train station, and to the Hyde Park. Other than that, I wouldn't recommend this hotel which doesn't live up to its 3-star status.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable and well placed cheap hotel”
Reviews.Author: sapiens
Reviews.Content: No need to spend too many words. Just a cheap hotel. No elevator - but as soon as we stayed on the 2nd floor - not a problem. Rooms small but clean, personal not annoying.. sometimes no personal at all :) Of course not for honeymoon, but completely OK if you need to spend some nights near the City Center. Pluses - quiet place (but not neighbours!), clean rooms, Hyde Park over the street, tube - 1 minute walk (Queensway), 2 minutes - Bayswater. Lots of bars and restaurants nearby (even with free WiFi) - from fast food to national cuisines. Minuses - very small rooms, shower need to be checked regularly. Breakfast may be more diverse, so you may miss it and do not regret :) 6 from 10

Reviews.Title: “It was an absolute nightmare”
Reviews.Author: mona005
Reviews.Content: The room was over 80 degrees F. We went there with the promise that we're getting the best room for my family of 5. We had absolulety no walking space. The room was over 80 degrees. No air conditioning- no drinking water- the coffee machine and four glasses were placed on top of an old worn out T.V., because there were no table or chairs. They had used every inch of that room to place beds next to each other. We had to place our luggeges in the walking space or on our beds. The window would only open at a 45 degrees angle, because it was blocked by a tall wall. no view. the fan and the safe did not work. Because of our short stay, we asked them to get us a working fan and fix the safe while we were going to tour the city and possibly some ice. They had no ice. the assistant mge, told me he can't get any, because he would need to leave his post and go to the hotel accross the way to get some ice. Their ice machine was apparentley broken. We were promised all will be taken care of by the time we get back. We returned to our room 6 hours later, and nothing had been done. we were extremely unsatisfied with the service. We left the hotel went next door to Troy hotel. a Hell and heaven difference. What a nice accomodating place. The apollo hotel assistant mgr. voided my receipt after all the complaints back and forth, but when we got back to US, I learned that he had ran my card again and forged my signature. They had committed Fraud. The place wa unbelievable. I don't know how they stay in business? I wish I knew about this site 2 years ago, I would've posted my review to save others from agony. pls see attached photos

Reviews.Title: “Please, but please, never stay there, better sleep on a bench...terrible hotel”
Reviews.Author: markos031
Reviews.Content: Well first of all, our ceiling was peeling off, than the radiator was so broken that the only thing that was holding it together was the bed pushing it against the wall to stay together...and the bed...well not a bed, the madrace well only the stell construction was left of it. no hot water in the bathroom and the linght didn't work, so many cracks on the wall that I just couldn't count them all, smell was really bas...al in all that hotel was the worst thing I have ever seen, but to be honest when you enter it does seem allright but it's really not...so please...never stay there...

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel EVER!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: leeview
Reviews.Content: Don't know where to start....first of all they gave me a room on the basement where my window view was a couple of pipes from the british garden, disgusting walls with feet marks, a small TV with no remote control, no doors on the wardrobe, the WC tank wasn't keeping the water in so it was keep flowing and therefore it wasn't flushing when you needed to, bathroom walls were DISGUSTING, we were afraid of touching them, shower head was full of water stone, we never had the bed sheets changed, the new towels were kept on the hotel floor before they were changed, last day we didn't even had hot water and heating, so we kinda' froze that night because we use the blanket they had on the bed cause we were afraid of getting all the diseases in the world by the way it looked. Breakfast was just croissant with jam, hotel receptionist wasn't professional at all, was having his breakfast in the lobby......they are just to many things to think of now, just DO NOT GO THERE

Reviews.Title: “the apollo wat can we say”
Reviews.Author: tcsca147
Reviews.Content: we booked this hotel and then found the reviews about a week later we wanted a weekend away first time since having a third daughter ... hotel staff on reception was ok ish room ok but raditor would not turn down so was on full all weekend making the room very hot had to sleep with the window open did ask for it to be fix but it did not happen first night no milk in room for tea / coffee.hotel very noise e could not sleep seam the room above was danceing all night breakfast ok after we ask for tea for two but when we got it was not nice second night ok room above must have gone as all quite but rad still on full and as it was heavey rain that night had to shut window so could not sleep as to hot would not stay here again from wat we seen the hotel should be shut and fully revampted at the moment this hotel ok for people who want to spend most of time away form it ..... the hotel across the road looks great but did not see it on the web when we was looking for a place to stay

Reviews.Title: “Don't Ever Stay There”
Reviews.Author: bosaBerlin
Reviews.Content: A friend of mine and I went to London for the weekend. We booked this hotel because it had a quite cheap offer for three nights. We didn`t exspect anything luxury as it was quite cheap. The room was dirty, the bathroom stank and the staff wasn`t very friendly - we didn`t mind as it was CHEAP ! In the first night, we had a crocroach in the bathroom. And that was even too much for us. So we talked to the receptionist and after 10 minutes of discussing what to do and him being very unhelpful and rude, he went upstairs with us. As the crocroach was still alive and could move, we couldn`t see it anymore and so the employee of the hotel decided " I can`t see it so it was never there, so you are lying" ! They insisted on the fact that there had never been a crocroach and that they are not willing to give us a refund of the money. We checked out straight away and checked in in another hotel. I am still trying to get our money back but they just don`t talk to me anymore ! So please do yourself a favour and DON`T EVER stay in that hotel !

Reviews.Title: “What are you all on about? It's a low-budget hotel but fine!”
Reviews.Author: hellonhighheels
Reviews.Content: First of all, we paid Â£42 a night per room and didn't exactly expect a four star hotel. After having read all the reviews online I was, as many other people, petrified about what would meet us. Got there and... IT IS FINE! Sure, the receptionist wasn't the most polite person I've ever met but he did what he was supposed to. We weren't there to have a chat with him, we were there to enjoy London. The room we got was alright, the sheets were clean, they changed our towels every day and made our beds. The TV was tiny but again, didn't go to London to watch TV all day. We had no bed bugs so don't get freaked out by that... My complains about the hotel would be the fact that there was no lift and that the breakfast was kind of sucky. Minor things really! I would stay there again, especially if on a tight budget.

Reviews.Title: “satisfied - Value for money”
Reviews.Author: carabax
Reviews.Content: I don't know what people expect for the price payed. Room linen was clean. Heater and hot water perfectly functionable. Abondant tea and coffee in room. Wort the money spent. Only complaint was that lift was not working and TV reception could be better.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel from hell!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Rosiewarrior
Reviews.Content: Well.. Where do I start? The beds don't have springs in them, there was no remote control for the television, the lift was broken, the receptionist was a stuck up uninterested bloke who was stuck to the computer chat and phone all day, even when our bathroom roof was caving in because someone had overflowen theyre bath upstairs. It took 4 hours to get someone to come and check it, so we spent our last day of the holiday waiting for s plumber/cleaner. Hotel staff generally unhelpful and rude, paint flaking off bathroom walls, no decoration on walls, very plain, 3 clothes hangers, a very small supply of toilet paper. Dirty bed covers, as if from WW2. Breakfast not even fit for pigs.the floorboards creek all night. All in all, we would of been better off sleeping in the london underground.... It's cleaner and the people are nicer!! WHATEVER YOU DO, DO NOT STAY HERE! THIS PLACE SHOULD BE SHUT DOWN

Reviews.Title: “Avoid This Dump! Terrible!”
Reviews.Author: Davey64
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel I have ever ever stayed in. Period. I asked for an extra blanket, since the heater was not working at all and the lazy night guy at the desk moaned and groaned because he had to get up away from his padded chair where he was always on the internet talking to some friend, he brought me a dirty stained thin bed spread from the dirty laundry (obviously). Also the hot water did not work, there was no way to even use the bath tub since it would not plug and they did not have a bath plug/stopper anywhere in the hotel! I used plastic bags to fill the tub with warm water. There was an 8 inch television about 20 feet away in the top corner of the room and the bed was noisy and the springs stuck us in the back all night! We were going to stay for another 7 nights but changed our minds after the terrible service and room. We complained and they gave us another room which was worse! When we checked out the next morning they got mad and yelled at us saying that "We just wanted to stay somewhere else". Ya think? Duh. DO NOT STAY HERE!!!! The Apollo -London - right near Bayswater! 65 pound per night!!!! YUCK!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “i read worst this is ok”
Reviews.Author: haron69
Reviews.Content: i stayed for one week form 14/01/10 i booked on internet after confirmtion i logo to trip advicer i shock becouse i booked in a cheape deal if i cancel i get 75% of my payment i have got no choice we arrived on 14/01 at 12 mid day the room was ready we get in every singel review i read about apollo was wrong good service nice rooms normal breakfast 24 houers reciption what i paid i get if you want to get more please book a 4/5 star hotel lovel stay i will stay agin

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: orltom1
Reviews.Content: Do not stay here, the stafff is truly awful and have no idea what cusotmer service is . I aked for an extra pillow and was told no. They did not ave any ! my TV remote was misiing, asked for another and was told no. The room was fitly and I had paid one wek in advance and could not leave, they would not refund, then the last night of my stay I was told I would have to leave one day early and check out one ngiht earlier becasue thier boiler broke , which was not true, they had overbooked and did not care that I had already paid for it and I had to find another place. The fact that it was a saturday night and I had already paid did not make any diffence to them. This place is awful and th staff is worse.

Reviews.Title: “Suits it's purpose”
Reviews.Author: ferrethead
Reviews.Content: For the money, it was just what I expected. I went to London to see the city, not to sit in my room. I wanted a clean room, clean sheets & bathroom. That's what I got. I also got great customer service - by the third morning, they knew I wanted tea with my breakfast. I got timely responses to requests, and they made every wake up call I asked for. If you just need a place to sleep between sightseeing treks, you couldn't want a better location - 2 tube stations, 3 bus lines. If you want luxury, you'll need to go somewhere else for it - and pay A LOT MORE for it, as well.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel EVER!!!”
Reviews.Author: nimzi
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for the price+location, but we've been to other hotels on the same rate and in good locations that where OK, this one was HORRIBLE! -the room was dirty -the mattresses where awful (you could fill the metal springs)! -the service was rude & offensive -the only reason we stayed was they DON'T ALLOW REFUND! they write they are *** but they are **, and so they claim when you complain.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs, Poor Service, Filthy Curtains”
Reviews.Author: aaronnelson
Reviews.Content: The net curtains were dark grey because they were so dirty. A week after leaving the hotel we have found we have bed bugs in our apartment back home. They also tried to charge us for using the safe in the room - there was not notice sed to pay. The receptionist's response was, "It's only Â£4 but if you can't afford it then don't". We arrived on the Friday night - the room was not made up, we returned to the receptionist who had to leave the desk and make up our room - leaving three sets of couples waiting 15 minutes to check in. The worst hotel I nhave ever stayed - and I've been to many.

Reviews.Title: “BED BUGS!!! NASTY NASTY NASTY”
Reviews.Author: khgo1
Reviews.Content: And to think that Virgin Vacations put us in this hotel. So sad. My wife and I have been all over the world and have gotten to stay in all kinds of hotels. We make fun of some of our friends that complain about hotels and service in other parts of the world because they expect "American style and service. Well we weren't expecting this hotel. As like most hotels in Europe the lobby and hallways are always nice and we exspected the room to be less than 3 star but this place was a DUMP. The room lwas smelly and parts of the floor boards were broken exspoing the wall behid it and then there were spots patched up with tape! I can let all that go but when we found bed bugs , that was it. We told the front dest and they said all the rooms were full so we couldn't move and then they asked us to show them a LIVE bed bug. We called Virgin and was told we could move to another hotel but we would have to pay for it and may not get reimbursed. Seeing as it was 11 at night we stayed..(slept in our clothes) the next morning I got up and foud a fat bug under me that I had squished. We showed this to the guy at the front desk as we checked out and he had nothing to say..really, not a word to us. No "sorry" ..nothing. DO NOT STAY HERE!!! Pay a little extra and go to the hotel across the street...really

Reviews.Title: “Dirty Dump”
Reviews.Author: Pazer88
Reviews.Content: Do not stay in this "Hotel". I read some of the reviews of this hotel and thought it cannot be that bad but it was. The rooms were dirty the, plumbing was faulty , the power went off twice because of the plumbing and the beds were uncomfortable.Breakfast was a joke and the staff were rude and disinterested. It was an insult to charge money to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Never again, siger vi fra Danmark”
Reviews.Author: skiltemanden
Reviews.Content: Never have I seen anything so bad, defective lavatory, no water in the shower because of the lime, carpet on the stairs was soaked in water, the most boring room without a picture on the wall, defect with the towel and toilet paper. Sorry for the translation is from google

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: AK-Gr8-1s
Reviews.Content: We have traveled all over Europe and other countries and have stayed in some pretty bad hotels. The Apollo was not one of them. We stayed for six nights in late April and found the hotel to be pretty much what we expected. The location was very good. An easy walk to bus stops and two tube stations, lots of little shops and restaurants close by. Our room was small, but clean. Breakfast was okay, with limited items. The staff was helpful. I agree with those reviewers that said if you want luxury, pay for it. It was our first time in London and we were there to see the city, not spend our time in the hotel. The Apollo worked out well for us and we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “adequate room, excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: Kostel
Reviews.Content: Hotel was OK. The elevator did not work once while we were there... (we were placed on the third floor.) The location was excellent; easy access and line changes for the underground.

Reviews.Title: “Bed bugs & Bad service!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Melle A
Reviews.Content: We were bitten by bed bugs and had welts all over our bodies. I have NEVER experienced this in a European hotel REGARDLESS of whether it was budget or not. The staff were apathetic, the lift was broken and despite being told in advance that I was pregnant they STILL put us on the 3rd floor! Terrible. Terrible. Terrible. Do not stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Loud hotel”
Reviews.Author: TorontoJojo6
Reviews.Content: I completely agree with "you get what you pay for" and certainly do not expect a luxury hotel at these prices. That said I don't expect to be staying in a youth hostel atmosphere either. The hotel is loud at the best of times. The doors slam shut which you can hear several floors away. Same thing goes for people walking up and down the stairs. When I stayed there, there were two groups of kids in the hotel. They were running up and down the stairs, congregating in the hallways etc. Groups of kids would gather in one room with the door open until all hours. The hotel staff was unable to control the noise and did not seem that concerned. I was told to address my concerns directly to the group leader. I was also told that I was just one person and they were 50 so that their needs took precedence over mine (meaning, the noise level was acceptable). One of the staff called my room after midnight to ask me if I had complained to the kids. He apparently thought this was an acceptable thing to do. I should also mention that I always stay at hotels of this price/value and have never complained before or written a review. At this hotel, I had to complain about the noise several times every night. Of course, it is a great location â€“ 2 minutes away from the tube and Hyde park. So, if you are not concerned about sleeping or are there on a week when in it quiet, it would be fine. However, if not, I would find another hotel. As well, the breakfast was terrible - buns and cereal. Nothing resembling meat, fruit/veg or dairy involved. Considering a typical English breakfast is quite substantial, I was pretty disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: KrisKIreland
Reviews.Content: After reading all of these reviews below me and my partner were dreading what we were getting in to. However, in my opinion they are totally unfounded. My partner and I stayed for five nights in one of the basement rooms â€“ which was one of the rooms most frequently mentioned on these reviews. We had a two minute hop to get to the door from the train station where we were welcomed by a very nice man at reception who checked us in and took our bags (we had arrived very early and check in was at two) so we could walk around and soak in the surroundings of Bayswater. We paid only 400 Euro for our whole stay of 5 nights so we were delighted. We were at Hyde Park and beside two different underground lines and also on a 24 hour bus route (so no need for taxis). T This is not a 5 star hotel and it certainly does not have 5 star prices. For that location in the centre of London I really thought it was a mistake and we were going to be surprised by a larger bill at the end. The room was perfect for resting your head, not palatial surroundings but very clean and plenty of hot water (from one of the best showers Iâ€™ve ever been in) and towels and room cleaned every day. If you go here thinking you are going to get a 5 star treatment at 2 star prices in Bayswater/Hyde Park area you really need to think twice before you even go to London let alone this hotel. But if you want basic facilities and just looking for somewhere to rest your head this hotel is perfect. If you want to pay 1000â€™s of Pounds and not stir outside your hotel then the Ritz is down the end of Bond street for that. Thanks Apollo, I had a great time and will definitely be back soon.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: famandersen
Reviews.Content: We just stayed in the hotel for 3 nigths- was one of the cheapest to get. One room on ground level with 5 beds- plenty of space for 3 persons. The other in the basement, very small, but both clean and ok. In the basement we were reminded that it was just above the central subway line, but after a long day we could sleep anyway. The staff were ok, we could check in very late at night. The breakfest was very basic, but good coffee. I would say, its ok if you just want a bed to sleep in. It was ok for the price. If you want luxery- pay for it!

Reviews.Title: “you get what you pay for......”
Reviews.Author: LadySugarfoot
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 3 night stay in London. Booked the hotel a couple of months ago (for Â£50 per room a night), before all the bad reviews, so I was worried about what we might find.We chose the hotel mainly for location, Bayswater is a smashing area to stay in, easy access to Tube stations, nice park to walk in and lots of decent restaurants to eat in. First night we spent at the Queens Park Hotel ( sister to Apollo) because there were no rooms available. Very damp/shabby /noisy and uncomfortable. Nights 2 and 3 spent on the third floor of the Apollo. Much better than Queens Park . Good points: the fish were alive and swimming, bed linen was clean and towels were plentiful, as was hot water, bed was comfortable, room was a good size, windows opened and reception staff were helpful. Bad points: lift not working ( and no-one offers to carry your cases!), electrics in room quite dodgy, curtain rail broken, breakfast extremely limited and staff not exactly helpful. Overall- cheap price=cheap hotel

Reviews.Title: “Come on everybody, it's not that bad!!”
Reviews.Author: Irishface
Reviews.Content: Alright folks, I am guessing that you have all read a few of the reviews before mine and you are thinking: NEVER! I felt exactly the same but the small number of good reviews (along with a very good weekend rate!) swung it for me and I went ahead and booked it. The room was a twin room. So let's get started...the hotel is located in the Bayswater area of London. The location is great! The Apollo is beside 2 tube stations (Bayswater and Queensway) so it is very convenient. Leicester Square is less than 10 minutes away on the tube! The hotel itself is fairly unassuming from the outside. We were greeted by a friendly receptionist who showed us to our room, which was in the basement. OK, the rooms are very basic. Ours was also ensuite. The decor is indeed a bit dated, but not dirty like some other reviewers found. The bathroom in our room was also basic, but functional. Towels were provided. I thought to myself...my God how fussy people are! Breakfast is also included. Very basic..cereal, bread, croissants, selection of jams etc., but we availed of it and it kept us going until lunch. So all in all we very happy with what we got for the price we paid. If you are looking for a romantic weekend or a weekend surprise for your Mum or Dad, then this is not the hotel for you. There is a Hilton hotel nearby...go a pay 200GBP a night there if you want! If, like us, you are not all that fussy, only intend to sleep there, want value for your money and a good location, then I would say go for it.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible, unwelcoming place”
Reviews.Author: tjorven1
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for two nights, the rooms were clean but shabby interiorwise. No openable windows, the temperature of the shower was not adjustable, it was either cold or getting too hot. The room was in a basement, smelling damp and unpleasant. But this was not the worst part: it was the staff and the noises in the hotel. There were parties going on above our room for the two nights and the staff at the reception didn't seem to bother very much after our complaint. It wasn't possible to sleep, even with earplugs. I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone, it seems more like a party place for teenagers.

Reviews.Title: “It is awful, people never book this hotel even for free of charge”
Reviews.Author: uliminate
Reviews.Content: I've booked this hotel with my friends. The location is good. But the rest............. The rooms are more than awful. The blankets were very dirty. I suppose they've never been cleaned before. Not all lamps were working there. One of the taps for cold water was not working. No service at all. It's even difficult to describe all. What a breakfast????? you can't call it breakfast. No hot water, all boilers out of work.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable! And not in a good way!!”
Reviews.Author: LianneBoggers
Reviews.Content: This place was unbelievable, ok so we wanted someweher cheap just to get our heads down after a concert but this was still a rip for Â£90 a night!!! The bath was full of hair and had opened/used shampoo sachets on the side so obviously had not been cleaned properly. The room had two small windows one of which had no lock. The room was shabby and cramped. The breakfast was a real highlight, i the continental breakfast consisted of a white roll, crossant (stale of course) or stale cornflakes. The milk had been sat around so long it was warm so vile. All inedible. The sign saying "we are not responsible for the safety of you're STUFF" says alot about the security of the rooms which had basic key locks. The staff were rude and unenthusiastic, in fact when we checked out the female on reception was shouting at two guests who had obviously complained before and wanted to check out early, apparently she "didnt have their money there" says alot.........dont book for more than one night at a time if you are that desperate for somewhere as they obviously do not refund!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Poor”
Reviews.Author: yorker123
Reviews.Content: Shabby and dingy and would be disappointed if a hostel was like this hotel.Encountered a couple of staff on reception who were helpful and one ignorant guy who seemed to flit around everywhere.Room was poor with marked walls,shower head holder wouldn't hold shower,knobs coming off furniture in your hand,curtain hanging off rail.Very basic continental breakfast.Clean sheets and towels and location was excellant.If you want a cheap break and can put up with very basic then ok.In fact, no dont bother-spend a bit more,we will next time.

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended”
Reviews.Author: ShinieDublin
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights with a a friend; bed was very uncomfortable, shower was difficult to regulate, breakfast was very basic and staff were indifferent to complaints. I found the hotel to be very noisy, no insulation between floors-could hear everything coming from the room above!! Night porters were indifferent to our complaints regarding the noise. The bed was the most uncomfortable I've ever slept in; breakfast was very basic and the staff did not make themselves known to guests-they were too busy chatting amongst themselves! It is cheap and a five minute walk from Queensway and Bayswater tube stations, however, I wouldn't recommend this hotel to anyone. Not a pleasant experience and the staff didn't seem to care.

Reviews.Title: “They have bugs”
Reviews.Author: GangsteLloyd
Reviews.Content: Recently me and my friends were staying in this hotel. While our stay we have discovered a variety of bugs in the hotel. During the first night it was impossible to sleep, because bed bugs were eating us. We took duties of sleep. While two of us slept another took a duty and was protecting us from four kinds of bed bugs. That's ridiculous! Next morning unfriendly sister of the manager (I guess), was shouting at me because I have not warned her about a room change earlier in the morning and now she have difficulties with giving an accomodation to other customers. Even though we have finally changed the room and the "sister" of manager was more friendly than before, the following night we have discovered another type of bug approximately half-hand size. Considering written above they told us that's the first case of having bugs and they are being checked by bug brigade every week.

Reviews.Title: “would not put the mother in-law in it.”
Reviews.Author: tipperarybobby
Reviews.Content: smelly ,dirty and ? for get it need sum serious make over staff as well paid on line and did not stay because of smell went across the street in stead.

Reviews.Title: “very basic”
Reviews.Author: didolancs
Reviews.Content: The room was fairly clean, and ensuite cleaned daily. The decor to the room was poor and in need of refurbishment. The beds were of very poor quality and uncomfortable. The shower hardly worked, and was no more than a dribble. The water temp was uncontrolable and at times scalding, I would not like to have left a child to shower. The plumbing was abismal, and it took 20 mins for the waste water to drain out. The staff were friendly at times and others just miserableIt took us 5 mins to summon the night porter as he was asleep.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location, economy accomodation”
Reviews.Author: avibags
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for Chelsea Flower show! Rooms adequate, clean and great shower for those axhing feet! Plenty places to eat, close to hyde park, and circle line stations. One drawback.. no air conditioning,so very warm at night.

Reviews.Title: “Better than feared, no complaints, recommended”
Reviews.Author: dinek
Reviews.Content: After the scary reviews, my wife and I arrived with some trepidation, even though we can handle just about anything thrown at us. We were pleasantly surprised that things were nowhere near as bad as feared, and somewhat better. We arrived from our flight a few hours before check-in, but the friendly staff was very accommodating in stowing our bags and coats until 2 PM when our room would be ready. We took advantage of the time by crossing the street to Hyde Park and spent the few hours visiting Kensington Palace and the grounds. On returning, we found our room to be small but adequate, with a double bed, wall-mounted TV, hot-water pot (with tea/coffee/creamer), desk, open closet (with 11 hangers, more than we usually find in most hotels!). The carpet was clearly new (the pile was so high, the inner door would rub against it!), there was fresh paint, and new tiles in the bathroom. There was only the tiniest of mildew above the shower knobs, some rust on the shower curtain rod (which was set too high, so the curtain was at the top of the tub, rather than setting inside), some dust behind the desk and radiator, and the furniture was a bit beat up, the elevator shaft was on the other side of the bathroom wall (we just kept the bathroom door closed at night), but these are minor concerns that did not detract from the rest. Sheets were clean, an extra coverlet was provided when asked for. As there are no wash cloths or hand towels, we asked for two extra bath towels and a bath mat towel, which were provided fresh each day from then on. Soap only in one pump bottle, which had to be brought over to the tub from the sink, no little bottles of shampoo and stuff, which is what we assumed for a budget hotel. Left a $10 deposit for a hair drier, returned upon our leaving. We preferred that they keep the keys when you go out; one less thing to worry about. A small hotel is nice because the clerk even knew which room key to hand us without us reminding him of our number! The room safe is large, and, though it does say it's 2 pounds per day, we were never asked or charged. We never needed the room's phone, and there were more than enough AC outlets. We never needed the radiator to be on, and opening the window provided fresh air without it getting too cold. Most guests seemed German or Dutch, and there were some student groups who were noisy and some of whom didn't follow the elevator maximum limit, which led to it being out of operation for part of one day; fortunately we only had to climb four flights once. Breakfast was OK, though mostly carbs, but that's continental breakfasts for you. We picked up some bananas locally to top our cereal. As a base, we couldn't have wanted better; buses on the corner (though road work made going to central London a bother; after one attempt, we stuck to the underground, which is rapid and goes everywhere), and a metro station two blocks west ,and many restaurants and convenience stores on that street. And Hyde Park. There were several similar converted townhouses on either side (with a AYCE Indian buffet next-door), and this seems a good alternative to overpriced hotels that don't do much better at meeting your basic sleeping and bathing needs.

Reviews.Title: “clean”
Reviews.Author: kate-and-mrR
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my mother and our neighbours, although we had a bit of trouble with one of the rooms the first night, the receptionist sorted it out. It was clean and in a brilliant spot. We couldnt ask for nicer staff, they were very friendly. All in all we had a brilliant time and overall was a nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “location and price”
Reviews.Author: AprilMoon
Reviews.Content: Ok hotel. Cheap, great location. Room were small, bathroom ok. Service and breakfeast ok. You have to leave your key to a staff member as you leave, which is weird. Great for budget travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Find another hotel - the price isn't worth the problems”
Reviews.Author: mudpatch
Reviews.Content: The dirty and dusty curtains in the bedroom were hanging off. There was a draught that was so cold from the windows, I had to remain dressed in a jumper and coat on top of my pyjamas to stay warm enough to sleep in spite of the radiator being on. There was a sheet and a coverlet on the bed â€“ no blankets. The temperature was below freezing. When I informed the owner in the morning, he said we should have called down and he would have moved us but heâ€™d already refused to move my nephew when we complained of a foul-smelling odour in his room with the excuse that the hotel was full, apparently. There was a steady stream of people complaining about all sorts of deficiencies in their rooms. Breakfast was badly served and poor. The receptionist/part-owner was surly, rude and un-cooperative. I would recommend avoiding a visit and certainly would not recommend paying in advance. I would describe it as a poor hostel.

Reviews.Title: “A nice accomodation, with no problems!”
Reviews.Author: Koumen
Reviews.Content: I was more than terrified reading the reviews and seeing the photos. However, my fears were proved wrong. I am not saying that all the previous reviews are wrong. I just claim that I was a lucky guy, or, better, I went to stay there in an off-peak period and, thus, I was given a good room and not "the bad stuff". I was staying in Apollo Hotel for 5 nights with my girlfriend. What we wanted was a cheap accomodation, since we are both university students (i.e. no much money), but still wanted to visit London. Well, I can say that it proved to be the best bargain we could make, in the low-budget hotels class. The room was painted green, the TV set was on the wall and not on a table, as I saw in one of the pictures here, the bathroom was nice, with a new equipment (at least, not that old as I saw in a photo here), with no fungus, or whatever another visitor saw. The only thing there, was that the faucet was full of dried salts from the water and the grid for the soap was bent due to rust. But these are minor details. In the overall, it was a nice room. There were one or two small holes on the bedsheet (teared points, actually), but they were all-white and clean. The cleaning ladies change the towels every day, lay the bed, sweep the carpet, clean the bathroom and the glass cups and the room smells fresh and clean when you enter it. The safe-deposit box is a little trap and you should pay attention to it: behind the door, the notice says that it is free of charge, but on the safe box there is a sticker with the instructions, along with the pricing "2 pounds per day". When we checked out, the receptionist asked us if we had used the safe box. Hopefully, we didn't. And we didn't pay anything more. Nor did we had any problems, concerning how much we payed the travel agent, etc., as a visitor reviews here. We were not even asked. The breakfast was really-really nice. Corn-flakes, fresh milk, orange juice, butter croissants, sometimes small round bread, butter and jam. And, once being served (actually, self-served) and having a seat, they ask you if you want coffee or tea. Really delicious, the breakfast. The "moody receptionists" that many here describe, did not seem moody to us at all. They were sometimes neutral (OK, what do you expect from them to do, when you give them your key, when going out?), never offensive or grumpy and caused no problem and no incovenience to us. Actually, one of them proved to be a humorist. Perfect located, between bayswater station (district/circle lines) and queensway station (centre line), the hotel location proved to be very functional, since we had access to three underground lines, all close to us. Also, there is nearby a bus stop nearby, which we used at night, when the Ungerground was closed, picking up bus N148 and went to Victoria railway station, taking afterwards the Gatwick express to Gatwick airport, to leave. The neighbourhood has also supermarkets, fast food restaurants, italian restaurants, oriental cuisine, greek cuisine, souvenir shops, etc. However, I said I consider myself just lucky. I don't believe, after all these bad reviews, that all the hotel's rooms are that nice. I just fell into an off-peak period. Therefore, I would recommend that hotel, but with a degree of uncertenty, concerning what the next customers would get as a room. However, me and my girlfriend were really satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Filthy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SallyGalway
Reviews.Content: Some friends and I stayed at the Apollo Hotel... when we booked it we knew it was going to be quite basic but we did not expect it to be so so so so so terrrible! We arrived at the hotel and the rooms were laughable, they are tiny and the curtains were absolutely wrank, they were meant to be cream coloured curtains but honestly they were dark brown from all the dirt. The carpet was disgusting as was the bedsheets which had holes in them!! Seriously you could only laugh. Luckily we did not need to spend much time in the rooms. On check out of course there was a problem with our bill and we were made speak to some woman on the phone who shouted down the phone at us... how professional! Unbelievable, the whole hotel and staff really are just unbelievable!

Reviews.Title: “Be under no illusion this is budget accomodation”
Reviews.Author: Katie_100
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Apollo with my husband for one night as were going to a concert in Hyde Park. The location is good, Hyde Park is a stones throw away and there is easy access to 3 tubes form the hotel. We booked a double ensuite room which was v small, the bedroom itsefl was very dated and had big scuff marks on the walls no doubt where fellow guests had wrestled with suitcases in the tight space. It was clean however, the bathroom also was dated but clean. the whole hotel seemed v tired and in need of updating. The breakfast was v v poor - continental (could tell as there were coissants) cornflakes and elderley looking pastries. For Â£89 I expect more, but this is central london so I think this is probably as good as it gets for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Fawlty Towers would have been a delight”
Reviews.Author: SybilFawltyNSW
Reviews.Content: We were booked into the London Apollo Hotel at Bayswater, which is ideally situated between Queensway & Bayswater stations, and a stones throw from Kensington Gardens â€“ location wise you couldnâ€™t ask for more. At the time of booking the hotel, I believed it was a three star & hence in our price range, unbeknown to ourselves, it is now rated on their website as a two star hotel, but when you in walk in thru their front doors all the stars have been taped over. We would have arrived at the hotel at around 6:30pm on the evening of the 1st June, 2008, which I thought was great as I would have time to check in, dump the luggage & get to White Chappell for a Jack the Ripper tour â€“ no such luck. On going to the first room, we discovered that rubbish had been left on a bed in the room, what looked like a huge mould patch in the top right hand corner of the room, and the phone didnâ€™t work. We had text a girlfriend of mine to say that we had arrived at the hotel & the hotel room we would be in, we text her while we were in reception before we went up to the room â€“ she phoned the hotel from a land line from where she was staying in London & there was no answer in our room, the chap on reception told her we must have gone out, we had just arrived, & just the way the chap spoke to my girlfriend, she did ask me if he was on this planet, he was un co-operative & not willing to do anything. Hence she text us wanting to know where we were as she had tried to phone, that is when we discovered the phone didnâ€™t work as we where in the room when she text us, so we phoned her on her mobile, I didnâ€™t have her land line number, from our mobile, we went thru international roaming to get to her on her mobile thru international roaming, Iâ€™m still waiting to see what the phone bill is going to be, all because the chap at reception was to lazy to get off his bum. I went downstairs to - one â€“ complain about the rubbish in the room & - two â€“ the phone not working. He apologized in a non-apologetic way & gave us a key to another room. I went back up to the fourth floor to gather up one husband & the luggage to move down to the second floor â€“ it was during the time of trying to go down in the lift the first time I realized the lift didnâ€™t work on the forth floor for the down button, you had to press the up button & hope for the best. Anyway down to the second floor & into the next room. It was smaller but looked cleaner, but was a little chilly, so we decided to close the window only to find the window was broken in the hinge hence we were unable to close the window. So I went downstairs & asked the chap if he could come up & close the window for us, to which he replied that he couldnâ€™t, he then gave me a key for another room. I went back up to get my husband, but left our luggage in the second room, we went off to the third room, which was at the base of some very narrow stairs, we walked into a very small room with a very large double bed, it was really a single room, you couldnâ€™t move in it let alone get the luggage in. The sheets looked gray & the room was dusty & a little musty. So I went back up to reception & told the chap that there was no way I was staying in that room & I wanted to talk to the manager/owner, of which he replied that he was, so I told him that I couldnâ€™t swing a cat in it, let alone get our luggage in there â€“ he wanted to know what I meant, so I told him that room was too small & it was not what I had paid for, he told me that there where no more rooms available, so I asked him to find me another hotel, miraculously another key for another room was presented, to which we went off to inspect. Room number four was on the ground floor, it had two double beds & two single beds & I could close the window. The lino on the floor looked new, where as the other rooms had carpet which was a bit worse for wear, but the lino looked like it had been a DIY lay, very rough. We werenâ€™t game enough to drink out of the cups & glasses provided. The chest of drawers had knobs broken off, but the phone did work. The wardrobe had part of the back missing & it looked like whoever swept in there swept the rubbish from the floor under the chest of drawers, I donâ€™t think anyone had swept from under the beds since the lino was laid. The bed boards above the beds had graffiti carved into them. All I could think of was that it was for only two nights. We had trouble trying to find the light switch for the light & fan for the bathroom, the chap from reception finally got off him bum to show us where the switch was, it was floor level behind a chair. The show curtain in the bathroom hadnâ€™t be hung correctly, so we showered with the curtain open for the first bathing session of which there was some water on the floor â€“ we had four large towels in the room, but no foot mat for the bathroom, hence we used a towel each, one as a foot mat & one to mop up, we were replaced with two very small towels, more the size of hand towels, the towel didnâ€™t go around me length wise & Iâ€™m a size 10 to 12, so I wonâ€™t say that I was a large person. Hence to say after getting our room sorted, it was too late to do the Jack the Ripper tour, & the tour that I wanted to do is only on a Sunday & Wednesday evenings, we arrived on the Sunday & flew home on the Tuesday evening, hence no Jack the Ripper tour - there were two things I really wanted to do in London â€“ a Jack the Ripper tour & Baker Street â€“ Baker Street I did, but no Ripper tour, so that has left a very sour taste & put on a damper on the only time we have ever been to London. This hotel is in a wonderful position, but it needs a lot of repairs & maintenance & the attitude problem of the chap we struck on reception needs to be addressed, there was a night receptionist chap who was quite pleasant, & another lass who was accommodating, but the first chap we struck, who also told me he was the manager/owner has absolutely no idea of what is expected by his guests, even Basil Fawlty could run rings around him. We stayed in a hostel in Edinburgh, it was wonderful & again it left the Apollo at Bayswater for dead. We wouldn't want anyone else to go through what we went through, time is precious especially when it is limited like ours was & to be mucked around like we were & to have your time wasted unnecessarily due to poor management is just not acceptable, and you wouldnâ€™t wish it upon anyone. Not happy Jan is a great understatement Two unhappy Aussies

Reviews.Title: “Lies Cheats and Theives!!”
Reviews.Author: Snoopy13132008
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival, we were immediately and rudely shafted off to another hotel because we were told that the room we had booked 3 months in advance had allegedley beed "flooded", they put us in a car and took us and luggage to another dodgey hotel for 2 nights (we had a booking for 3 nights) and said they would pick us up to return. After the 2nd night at the dodgy hotel, we called the Apollo hotel to pick us up for the return for the last night and the man blatantly refused to pick us up and told us to make our own way back, we explained that it was too far to walk (approximately 25 blocks away) with all our luggage and could not afford to pay a taxi and when we asked to speak to the Manager, he refused saying the Manager was busy. When we finally arrived at the Apollo Hotel after walking in the rain with our suitcases for over an hour, the man was very rude and racist towards us, saying "you are not Australians" he even told us to leave but we said we have a booking and we were prepared to call the police, completely and utterly rude, self centred, run by a racist Afgan family, who want to take our money but not willing to accomodate us in what we had paid for, what a disgrace, they should be ashamed of themselves to call themselves a hotel, we want to report them to London Authorities for their inhumane treatment to their customers, what a nightmare, our bad luck for landing there, ruined our trip left us feeling angry and stressed when we should have been in holiday mode

Reviews.Title: “Ghastly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: elsEdmontonAlberta
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with a group of students and was horrified by the conditions of the rooms. The carpets, walls, and bedspreads were filthy. There were holes in the floor and bare electrical wires. One of our rooms had the shower door completely ripped off and the door handle in that room was broken. We found the night staff to be very rude. When my room was not made up by 8 p.m. I was told that the maid was sick and that no one would be making up my room that night. This is also the only hotel I've ever stayed in that charged to use the room safes. Never stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Apollo is a good bargain!”
Reviews.Author: SunnyGirlie
Reviews.Content: I chose Apollo because of the location, and it was only after I already paid I started to read all these reviews. I tell you I was so nervous when I finally got there - after seeing all these horrible pictures and reading all these incredibly negative reviews. Then when I got there I realised that most of these reviews were probably written by people who have no idea what to expect from a hotel as cheap as Apollo. I can tell you I've stayed at hotels far worse - and even then I wasn't nearly as angry about my stay. What it all comes down to is what you pay for, isn't it? Apollo is one of the cheapest hotels in the Bayswater area, so how can you expect a luxury hotel? And these pictures - UGH! I saw nothing of that kind in my room, that's for sure - I'm wondering if some people may actually be searching with a flashlight to see all the flaws, and concentrate only on the negative aspects. Apollo hotel is a cheap budget hotel, but you get what you pay for. You want something better? Just pay more and stop complaining!

Reviews.Title: “Never stay in this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Marie24Ireland
Reviews.Content: I had booked this hotel for a weekend away with my family. We choose it due to its handy location. On arrival the reception area looked fine, we used the lift to get to our room which was on the fifth floor. As we walked to our room the smell and appearance of the floor was very poor. We opened our bedroom door, which had a lock that was very insecure. The room itself had three single beds and one double, there was three of us. This made the room very cramped. It had a strong musty smell, very little natural light, the one small window was decorated with a dirty netting and curtains that didnt hang properly. The bathroom was tiny with a dirty shower curtain and and clogged vent full of dust. We had felt the room very cold and when asked about the central heating at the reception we were told it was broken. The lift broke down the second night so we had to walk too many flights of stairs to our room. Breakfast wasnt nice with just cornflakes, hard croissants, and tea or coffee to choose from. I would never recommend this hotel, its smelly, horrible and the staff are extremely unhelpful.

Reviews.Title: “Anywhere but Here!!”
Reviews.Author: Loulou112
Reviews.Content: We had a room so small that our 2 suitcases could not fit in the room. (Note we travelled all over the world and we did not pay any excess baggage - so no, our bags were not too big). Rooms were stuffy, smelly and had no natural light. We arrived after 36hrs of flying and transit to be told no hot water for another 3 hrs - they turn the water off during the day - even when guests can start checking in (apparently because they have been advised by their gas supplier to do this!). Water pressure was an impressive - dribble! They were rude & completely unaccomodating. I would rather stay in a dorm room in a hostel than this place.

Reviews.Title: “Ruined my Son's 18th”
Reviews.Author: Jacqui1959
Reviews.Content: I arranged a suprise trip for my Son's 18th Birthday, which included tavel by train, hotel stay and a night at the theatre. We are not wealthy so booked a budget hotel as it was just somewhere to sleep, but didn't expect this!!! When we arrived approx 10.30am on the Friday morning the 'Gentleman' on the desk was quite curt and told us room not ready till 2.00pm (although he did let us leave suitcase). Arrived back at 2pm and a more polite young man checked us in and gave us our key. We did have to find the room ourself though!. We were on the 5th floor. Room very very standard, three beds, queen - double - single. Single bed springs gone!! Only One pillow each, thin sheet and a throwover, no quilt or blankets. Lampshade missing off wall lamp. Bathroom tiny with cracked tiles on floor, light over sink held together by tape!! toilet roll holder broken, and shower looked uninviting!! Kettle was nowhere near a socket, had to take it over to bedside cabinet to boil it!! TV remote had NO batteries. I did call reception and asked for more pillows and a working remote, these arrived later in evening whilst we were at the theatre. Very pleasant young man on reception when we arrived back. The final straw for me though was next morning at breakfast (if you could call it that!!).
